text: The men's long jump competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 7 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was João Carlos de Oliveira of Brazil. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |8.45 |Montreal, Canada |July 25, 1975 |- |Pan American Games record | |8.29 |Winnipeg, Canada |1967 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |João Carlos de Oliveira | |8.18 | |- | |David Giralt | |8.15 | |- | |Carl Lewis | |8.13 | |- |4 |Altevir de Araújo | |7.73 | |- |5 |Ray Quiñones | |7.52 | |- |6 |Richard Rock | |7.31 | |- |7 |Agustín Neuland | |7.31 | |- |8 |Calvin Greenaway | |6.85 | |- | |Larry Myricks | | | |- | |Dennis Trott | | | |- | |Wilfredo Almonte | | | |- | |Cornelius Everton | | | |- | |Steve Hanna | | | |- | |Ronald Chambers | | | |- | |Alejandro Cardona | | | |- | |Edgar Moreno | | | |- | |José Salazar | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Men's long jump
